New Records: The Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win its first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42, tying the eighth largest in the NBA's shot clock era, and equaled the team record for points in a half.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson's up-tempo style quickly won over the face of the franchise, All-Star shooting guard Donovan Mitchell.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson said, '10-0 is something. It's kind of a magic number, right?' and 'I was worried about tonight because the Warriors are champions. That surprised me, how ready we were, how hungry we were.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers also are the first team to start 10-0 since the 2015-16 Warriors and lead the league in points per game at 124.5 with a.527 field goal percentage.
Others: Backup guard Ty Jerome, who scored a season-high 20 points against Golden State, said 'We're playing fast, and we're playing the right way, everyone is making shots, and everyone is having fun.'
